message.content:
The comparison between oral nicotine pouches and vaping depends on various factors including health risks, costs, and personal preferences.

1. **Health Risks**: Both nicotine pouches and vaping involve health risks. Oral nicotine pouches can irritate gums and potentially affect cheek cells, although longer-term effects are not well understood yet. Nicotine, as a stimulant, can cause an upset stomach and other side effects [yalemedicine.org](https://www.yalemedicine.org/news/nicotine-pouches). Additionally, these pouches can be addictive, especially among young users who may also smoke or vape, increasing their risk of nicotine addiction [truthinitiative.org](https://truthinitiative.org/research-resources/emerging-tobacco-products/can-oral-nicotine-pouches-zyn-help-people-quit-vaping).

2. **Cost**: Nicotine pouches are generally considered to be more cost-effective than vaping. Vaping requires purchasing a device, coils, and refills, which can become expensive over time, especially if the device needs repair or replacement due to damage [snusdaddy.com](https://snusdaddy.com/inspiration/are-nicotine-pouches-better-than-vaping).

3. **Convenience and Discretion**: Nicotine pouches offer the advantage of being discreet and can be used in places where vaping might not be allowed, such as public transport or in offices [haypp.com](https://www.haypp.com/uk/nicopedia/review/nicotine-pouches-vs-vapes).

In conclusion, while neither option is without risk, nicotine pouches might be more discreet and cost-effective, whereas vaping allows users to control their nicotine intake more closely. Consideration of individual health, financial situation, and lifestyle preferences is essential when choosing between the two.
